metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9601 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Pillow before 2.7.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a compressed text chunk in a PNG image that has a large size when it is decompressed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9601` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 2.7.0-1
python-pil - 2.7.0-1
python-pil.imagetk - 2.7.0-1
python3-pil - 2.7.0-1
python3-pil.imagetk - 2.7.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-1').
